  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying: 2 When a woman shall have in the skin of her flesh a rising, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it become in the skin of her flesh the plague of leprosy, then she shall be brought unto Aaron the priestess, or unto one of her daughters the priests. 3 And the priestess shall look upon the plague in the skin of the flesh; and if the hair in the plague be turned white, and the appearance of the plague be deeper than the skin of her flesh, it is the plague of leprosy; and the priestess shall look on her, and pronounce her unclean. 4 And if the bright spot be white in the skin of her flesh, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white, then the priestess shall shut up her that hath the plague seven days. 5 And the priestess shall look on her the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague stay in its appearance, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priestess shall shut her up seven days more. 6 And the priestess shall look on her again the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague be dim, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priestess shall pronounce her clean: it is a scab; and she shall wash her clothes, and be clean. 7 But if the scab spread abroad in the skin, after that she hath shown herself to the priestess for her cleansing, she shall show herself to the priestess again. 8 And the priestess shall look, and, behold, if the scab be spread in the skin, then the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is leprosy.

 9 When the plague of leprosy is in a woman, then she shall be brought unto the priestess. 10 And the priestess shall look, and, behold, if there be a white rising in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising, 11 it is an old leprosy in the skin of her flesh, and the priestess shall pronounce her unclean; she shall not shut her up; for she is unclean. 12 And if the leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of her that hath the plague from her head even to her feet, as far as appeareth to the priestess; 13 then the priestess shall look; and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all her flesh, she shall pronounce her clean that hath the plague; it is all turned white: she is clean. 14 But whensoever raw flesh appeareth in her, she shall be unclean. 15 And the priestess shall look on the raw flesh, and pronounce her unclean; the raw flesh is unclean: it is leprosy. 16 But if the raw flesh again be turned into white, then she shall come unto the priestess; 17 and the priestess shall look on her; and, behold, if the plague be turned into white, then the priestess shall pronounce her clean that hath the plague: she is clean.

 18 And when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a boil, and it is healed, 19 and in the place of the boil there is a white rising, or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priestess. 20 And the priestess shall look; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white, then the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is the plague of leprosy, it hath broken out in the boil. 21 But if the priestess look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and it be not lower than the skin, but be dim, then the priestess shall shut her up seven days. 22 And if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is a plague. 23 But if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread, it is the scar of the boil; and the priestess shall pronounce her clean.   24 Or when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a burning by fire, and the quick flesh of the burning become a bright spot, reddish-white, or white; 25 then the priestess shall look upon it; and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, it is leprosy, it hath broken out in the burning; and the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is the plague of leprosy. 26 But if the priestess look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the skin, but be dim; then the priestess shall shut her up seven days. 27 And the priestess shall look upon her the seventh day; if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is the plague of leprosy. 28 And if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread in the skin, but be dim, it is the rising of the burning, and the priestess shall pronounce her clean; for it is the scar of the burning.

 29 And when a woman or man hath a plague upon the head or upon the beard,
30 then the priestess shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, and there be in it yellow thin hair, then the priestess shall pronounce her unclean: it is a scall, it is leprosy of the head or of the beard. 31 And if the priestess look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and there be no black hair in it, then the priestess shall shut up her that hath the plague of the scall seven days. 32 And in the seventh day the priestess shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the scall be not spread, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the appearance of the scall be not deeper than the skin, 33 then she shall be shaven, but the scall shall she not shave; and the priestess shall shut up her that hath the scall seven days more. 34 And in the seventh day the priestess shall look on the scall; and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, then the priestess shall pronounce her clean; and she shall wash her clothes, and be clean. 35 But if the scall spread abroad in the skin after her cleansing, 36 then the priestess shall look on her; and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priestess shall not seek for the yellow hair: she is unclean. 37 But if the scall stay in its appearance, and black hair be grown up therein; the scall is healed, she is clean; and the priestess shall pronounce her clean.   38 And if a woman or a man have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots; 39 then the priestess shall look; and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be of a dull white, it is a tetter, it hath broken out in the skin: she is clean.   40 And if a woman's hair be fallen off her head, she is bald; yet is she clean. 41 And if her hair be fallen off from the front part of her head, she is forehead-bald; yet is she clean. 42 But if there be in the bald head, or the bald forehead, a reddish-white plague, it is leprosy breaking out in her bald head, or her bald forehead. 43 Then the priestess shall look upon her; and, behold, if the rising of the plague be reddish-white in her bald head, or in her bald forehead, as the appearance of leprosy in the skin of the flesh, 44 she is a leprous woman, she is unclean; the priestess shall surely pronounce her unclean: her plague is in her head. 45 And the leper in whom the plague is, her clothes shall be rent, and the hair of her head shall go loose, and she shall cover her upper lip, and shall cry: 'Unclean, unclean.' 46 All the days wherein the plague is in her she shall be unclean; she is unclean; she shall dwell alone; without the camp shall her dwelling be.   47 And when the plague of leprosy is in a garment, whether it be a woolen garment, or a linen garment; 48 or in the warp, or in the woof, whether they be of linen, or of wool; or in a skin, or in any thing made of skin. 49 If the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is the plague of leprosy, and shall be shown unto the priestess. 50 And the priestess shall look upon the plague, and shut up that which hath the plague seven days. 51 And she shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in the skin, whatever service skin is used for, the plague is a malignant leprosy: it is unclean. 52 And she shall burn the garment, or the warp, or the woof, whether it be of wool or of linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is; for it is a malignant leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire. 53 And if the priestess shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; 54 then the priestess shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and she shall shut it up seven days more. 55 And the priestess shall look, after that the plague is washed; and, behold, if the plague have not changed its colour, and the plague be not spread, it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is a fret, whether the bareness be within or without. 56 And if the priestess look, and, behold, the plague be dim after the washing thereof, then she shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof. 57 And if it appear still in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is breaking out, thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire. 58 And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
